page.title: 07The Parish Church
page.content: The Church of St James, with its 100 ft tower and 6 bells, dominates the village of Egerton. It dates from the C13, C14 and C15 and examples of each period of architecture can be seen. St. James's is the first church known to have an organ in England, dating from 1531, and the church continues its fine traditions of music and singing to the present day. There is a magnificent collection of ancient church plate and many gifts to the church have been made by parishioners throughout the ages. The 500 yr old stone font lies in the church beneath the tower. Up until the Reformation the church was called the Blessed Mary at Egerton. Now as St James, it is in the patronage of the Dean and Chapter of St Paul's who have helped considerably in the cost of extensive renovations.
